result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J. Paul was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact w/ Alyssa Melton

Eligible for expungment.

supervisions.notes: HUBER--May serve in Barron County or Chippewa County as long as no cost to Washburn.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin J. Paul

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Benjamin J. Paul appeared with Attorney Chad C La Lor.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State. Court appears via video.

9:34 AM Court recites case and appearances. Court questions counsel re: objection to the Court appearing via video. No objection from the State. No objection from Attorney La Lor. State received a copy of the revocation packet and did not find any errors or corrections. Attorney La Lor received a copy of the revocation packet, went over it with defendant and did not find any errors or corrections. Court questions counsel re: days credit. State and counsel agree defendant would have 148 days credit. State makes statement re: no victim right's to address.

State makes argument for sentencing and agrees with recommendation in revocation packet. Attorney La Lor makes argument for sentencing. Defendant exercises his right to allocution. Court makes statement to defendant. 

Court so orders:

EACH COUNT: 270 days jail - concurrent -- can serve in Barron County or Chippewa County as long as there is no cost to Washburn County. Defendant allowed huber. Defendant allowed good time. 148 days credit. 10:01 AM Adjourned
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2019 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 30, 2019 at 11:00 am.

09:46 AM Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Defendant Benjamin J. Paul. Prosecuting Atty Angeline E Winton appeared for State of Wisconsin. Set for SEHR.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for January 30, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on December 11, 2018 at 08:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls case and appearances.  State files an amended complaint. Waived reading.  Court questions the def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.   Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis.  

Count 1-Def. pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.
Count 2- Def. pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.


Sentencing--2 years probation + costs
Eligible for expungment. No contact w/ Alyssa Melton.  39 Days credit.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on December 5, 2016 at 08:00 am.
for Bail Modification
Status conference on October 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. DA Frost requests Bench Warrant and a forf of a bond. Atty Perrin objects to bench warrant and makes statement. Court auth bond forf. proceedings (if Mr Paul shows up within 30 days it hasn't been forf. yet so MR Paul can make an arguement. after 30 days  the bond with be forf. completely) If DE doesn't show up in the next 48 hours, the JT will come off of the calendar. Parties make arguments. Court sets deadling for end of day Tuesday, 9-20-16, to hear from Mr Paul, if no contact is made the JT will be removed from the calendar. 

Court in recess. DE is calling Atty Perrin. 

Court back on record. ATty Perrin makes statement regarding her DE not showing up. DE is at work today, wasn't aware of court today. Court address bail bond of $5000 and bail jumping and his 2nd degree sex assault. parties clarify charges. Atty Perrin makes statement. DA Frost makes statement. Court stands with decision. DE must appear by Tues, 9-20-16, if no appearance, JT will be removed from calendar and a possible forf of his bond, a bench warrant is to be issued. Atty Perrin makes statement about DE appearing in person. DA Frost makes statement. Court denies request, DE must appear in person. DA Frost makes statement regarding a Discovery issue and not receiveing it yet. ATty Perrin makes statement. Court advised DA Frost to use discresion about time frame when that time comes.

Prior: 1996  22nd 1/2 St, #364, Rice Lake, WI 54871
Status conference on September 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Benjamin J. Paul appeared with Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. Also has 15 CF 162.  State speaks re: status of the case asking for an adjournment for the trial. Court speaks to the state. Parties to call Judge's office to set a new time for trial. Atty Perrin speaks re: bond.  Bond is modified from 10pm-6am.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

All parties appear by phone means. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Perrin asking for a bond review. State objects-Def. does not currently have employment. Atty Perrin speaks to the court.  Court makes statement.  Bail will continue as is.
State's
in Posting Bond
Posted at Washburn County Sheriff Office on 12/28/15
Addendum to Bail Bond $1000 cash-Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption.

Telephone conference at 02-08-2016 02:45 pm.
Status conference at 04-25-2016 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 05-12-2016 08:00 am.

Waived reading. Not guilty. Court speaks re: motion filed by Atty Perrin.  State speaks to the court and is not oppose to a reduction in bail. Court amends bail to $1,000.00 cash bond. Court reviews bail. State asks that not to enter an establishment to that serves alcohol for consumptions. Court amends bail.

Defendant Benjamin J. Paul in court with attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin.  Defendant Benjamin J. Paul in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls Inv. Fisher to the stand. Clerk swears in Inv. Fisher. State begins questioning.  Inv. Fisher identifies the def.  No futher questions from the State.  Cross from Atty Perrin.  Nothing further from Atty Perrin. Redirect from the State. Witness is excused. Argument. Court speaks to the parties. Court finds there is probable cause. The def. is bound over.  Telephone conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:00 am.
